paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The variant most commonly associated with cardiomyopathy is V122I which is present in 34% of African Americans.

individual_records.phenotype_details: mild cardiac symptoms, no heart failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The variant most commonly associated with cardiomyopathy is V122I which is present in 34% of African Americans.
The variant most commonly associated with cardiomyopathy is V122I which is present in 34% of African Americans.

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant leads to misfolding of TTR protein, increasing amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on population studies and functional assays.
variants.additional_notes: The V122I variant is a significant risk factor for developing cardiac amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The variant most commonly associated with cardiomyopathy is V122I which is present in 34% of African Americans.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
